Posts.Content: Hi all, I hope I’m in the right place and I’m sorry if I’m not! I’m struggling to support my best friend.  She has recently undergone a mastectomy, lymph node removal and nerves taken from her tummy. She is extremely private and never asks for help. I feel like I almost force my help on her and her family. It was her first sos of chemotherapy today and we’ve been chatting via text. She’s just told me she’s struggling. I have no idea how to help her... apart from the little trinkets I’ve found for her over the last few months, flowers etc, I do not know what else to do... If anyone has any advise or words of wisdom that would be great. To top it all off hubby has just started radiotherapy for his cancer - but that’s another story! Thank you for reading my post. Love to all ❤️
Posts.Title: Advise for a friend of a breast cancer sufferer

Posts.Content: Thank you for the replies, thought I was a lot tougher but the kind words have made me realise I’m not a robot! Thank you. I want to write more but washing up to do and dog needs a quick walk, I want the children in bed now too!  I’ll def be back to try and help others in the same boat. As I keep saying to them, one day at a time, I guess it’s goes for me. Thank you again for your time.  Love to all.
